verses.verse: It happened after this, <S%H310><s%> that Nahash <S%H5176><s%> the king <S%H4428><s%> of the children <S%H1121><s%> of Ammon <S%H5983><s%> died, <S%H4191><s%> and his son <S%H1121><s%> reigned in his place. <S%H4427><s%>

David <S%H1732><s%> said, <S%H559><s%> "I will show <S%H6213><s%> kindness <S%H2617><s%> to Hanun <S%H2586><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of Nahash, <S%H5176><s%> because his father <S%H1><s%> showed <S%H6213><s%> kindness <S%H2617><s%> to me. <S%H1732><s%>" So David sent <S%H7971><s%> messengers <S%H4397><s%> to comfort <S%H5162><s%> him concerning his father. <S%H1><s%> David <S%H1732><s%>'s servants <S%H5650><s%> came <S%H935><s%> into the land <S%H776><s%> of the children <S%H1121><s%> of Ammon <S%H5983><s%> to Hanun, <S%H2586><s%> to comfort him. <S%H5162><s%>

But the princes <S%H8269><s%> of the children <S%H1121><s%> of Ammon <S%H5983><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to Hanun, <S%H2586><s%> "Do you think <S%H5869><s%> that David <S%H1732><s%> honors <S%H3513><s%> your father, <S%H1><s%> in that he has sent <S%H7971><s%> comforters <S%H5162><s%> to you? <S%H5650><s%> Haven't his servants come <S%H935><s%> to you to search, <S%H2713><s%> to overthrow, <S%H2015><s%> and to spy out <S%H7270><s%> the land? <S%H776><s%>"

So Hanun <S%H2586><s%> took <S%H3947><s%> David <S%H1732><s%>'s servants, <S%H5650><s%> and shaved <S%H1548><s%> them, <S%H3772><s%> and cut off their garments <S%H4063><s%> in the middle, <S%H2677><s%> even to their buttocks, <S%H4667><s%> and sent them away. <S%H7971><s%>

Then there went <S%H3212><s%> certain persons, <S%H5046><s%> and told David <S%H1732><s%> how the men <S%H582><s%> were served. <S%H7971><s%> He sent to meet <S%H7125><s%> them; <S%H582><s%> for the men were greatly <S%H3966><s%> ashamed. <S%H3637><s%> The king <S%H4428><s%> said, <S%H559><s%> "Stay <S%H3427><s%> at Jericho <S%H3405><s%> until your beards <S%H2206><s%> have grown, <S%H6779><s%> and then return. <S%H7725><s%>"

When the children <S%H1121><s%> of Ammon <S%H5983><s%> saw <S%H7200><s%> that they had made themselves odious <S%H887><s%> to David, <S%H1732><s%> Hanun <S%H2586><s%> and the children <S%H1121><s%> of Ammon <S%H5983><s%> sent <S%H7971><s%> one thousand <S%H505><s%> talents <S%H3603><s%> of silver <S%H3701><s%> to hire <S%H7936><s%> them chariots <S%H7393><s%> and horsemen <S%H6571><s%> out of Mesopotamia, <S%H763><s%> and out of Arammaacah, <S%H758><s%> and out of Zobah. <S%H6678><s%>

So they hired <S%H7936><s%> for themselves thirty <S%H7970><s%> - two <S%H8147><s%> thousand <S%H505><s%> chariots, <S%H7393><s%> and the king <S%H4428><s%> of Maacah <S%H4601><s%> and his people, <S%H5971><s%> who came <S%H935><s%> and encamped <S%H2583><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> Medeba. <S%H4311><s%> The children <S%H1121><s%> of Ammon <S%H5983><s%> gathered themselves together <S%H622><s%> from their cities, <S%H5892><s%> and came <S%H935><s%> to battle. <S%H4421><s%>
When David <S%H1732><s%> heard <S%H8085><s%> of it, <S%H7971><s%> he sent Joab, <S%H3097><s%> and all the army <S%H6635><s%> of the mighty men. <S%H1368><s%>

The children <S%H1121><s%> of Ammon <S%H5983><s%> came out, <S%H3318><s%> and put the battle <S%H4421><s%> in array <S%H6186><s%> at the gate <S%H6607><s%> of the city: <S%H5892><s%> and the kings <S%H4428><s%> who had come <S%H935><s%> were by themselves in the field. <S%H7704><s%>

The rest <S%H3499><s%> of the people <S%H5971><s%> he committed <S%H5414><s%> into the hand <S%H3027><s%> of Abishai <S%H52><s%> his brother; <S%H251><s%> and they put themselves in array <S%H6186><s%> against <S%H7125><s%> the children <S%H1121><s%> of Ammon. <S%H5983><s%>

He said, <S%H559><s%> "If the Syrians <S%H758><s%> are too strong <S%H2388><s%> for me, <S%H8668><s%> then you are to help me; <S%H1121><s%> but if the children of Ammon <S%H5983><s%> are too strong <S%H2388><s%> for you, <S%H3467><s%> then I will help you.

Be courageous, <S%H2388><s%> and let us be strong <S%H2388><s%> for our people, <S%H5971><s%> and for the cities <S%H5892><s%> of our God. <S%H430><s%> May Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> do <S%H6213><s%> that which seems <S%H5869><s%> good to him. <S%H2896><s%>"

So Joab <S%H3097><s%> and the people <S%H5971><s%> who were with him drew near <S%H5066><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> the Syrians <S%H758><s%> to the battle; <S%H4421><s%> and they fled <S%H5127><s%> before him. <S%H6440><s%>

When the children <S%H1121><s%> of Ammon <S%H5983><s%> saw <S%H7200><s%> that the Syrians <S%H758><s%> had fled, <S%H5127><s%> they likewise fled <S%H5127><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> Abishai <S%H52><s%> his brother, <S%H251><s%> and entered <S%H935><s%> into the city. <S%H5892><s%> Then Joab <S%H3097><s%> came <S%H935><s%> to Jerusalem. <S%H3389><s%>

When the Syrians <S%H758><s%> saw <S%H7200><s%> that they were defeated by Israel, <S%H3478><s%> they sent <S%H7971><s%> messengers, <S%H4397><s%> and drew forth <S%H3318><s%> the Syrians <S%H758><s%> who were beyond <S%H5676><s%> the River, <S%H5104><s%> with Shophach <S%H7780><s%> the captain <S%H8269><s%> of the army <S%H6635><s%> of Hadadezer <S%H1928><s%> at their head. <S%H6440><s%>

It was told <S%H5046><s%> David; <S%H1732><s%> and he gathered <S%H622><s%> all Israel <S%H3478><s%> together, <S%H5674><s%> and passed over the Jordan, <S%H3383><s%> and came <S%H935><s%> on them, <S%H6186><s%> and set the battle in array against them. <S%H1732><s%> So when David had put the battle <S%H4421><s%> in array <S%H6186><s%> against <S%H7125><s%> the Syrians, <S%H758><s%> they fought with him. <S%H3898><s%>

The Syrians <S%H758><s%> fled <S%H5127><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> Israel; <S%H3478><s%> and David <S%H1732><s%> killed <S%H2026><s%> of the Syrians <S%H758><s%> the men of seven <S%H7651><s%> thousand <S%H505><s%> chariots, <S%H7393><s%> and forty <S%H705><s%> thousand <S%H505><s%> footmen, <S%H376><s%> and killed <S%H4191><s%> Shophach <S%H7780><s%> the captain <S%H8269><s%> of the army. <S%H6635><s%>
